title: Ban on Beer Is Latest Flash Point in World Cup Culture Clash
abstract: Qatar’s about-face on alcohol signaled that FIFA, soccer’s governing body, may no longer be in full control of its showcase championship.

multimedia.caption: Qatar’s ban on beer in stadiums complicated FIFA’s relationship with Budweiser, which pays $75 million every four years to be associated with the World Cup.
multimedia.copyright: Patrick T. Fallon/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
